meanings.definition: A body of troops stationed in a fortified place.
meanings.sent1: The garrisons protected the castle from enemy attacks.
meanings.sent2: The king ordered the garrisons to defend the city walls.
meanings.sent3: The garrisons in the fort were always ready for battle.
meanings.sent4: The garrisons stood like vigilant guardians of the stronghold.
meanings.sent5: The garrisons were the brave soldiers who safeguarded the fortress.

meanings.definition: To provide (a place) with a garrison.
meanings.sent1: The general decided to garrison the town to ensure its safety.
meanings.sent2: They garrisoned the border to prevent any intrusions.
meanings.sent3: Let's garrison this old house with our toy soldiers for fun.
meanings.sent4: The troops garrisoned the village, turning it into a secure zone.
meanings.sent5: We will garrison the outpost to maintain control of the area.

meanings.sent1: The army decided to garrison the valley for strategic reasons.
meanings.sent2: They garrisoned the town square during the festival.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended to garrison the playground with their toy soldiers.
meanings.sent4: The soldiers garrisoned the hill, ready to defend it at all costs.
meanings.sent5: The military planned to garrison the forest to secure the area.
